channel.title: Findings on Virginia Tech
channel.description: Recent content in Findings on Virginia Tech

item.title: Eviction Rate Regression Model
item.description: Main Findings This research uses data from The Eviction Lab at Princeton University, a project directed by Matthew Desmond and designed by Ashley Gromis, Lavar Edmonds, James Hendrickson, Katie Krywokulski, Lillian Leung, and Adam Porton. The Eviction Lab is funded by the JPB, Gates, and Ford Foundations as well as the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. More information is found at evictionlab.org. For our primary data source, we used the Eviction Labâ€™s records on evictions at the 2010 census tract level for all cities.

item.title: Results Section One
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3 { text-align: center; } Examples Page If you want to add in an image on an Rmd file, use this link here. It ends up being a little tricky, but as long as you have created a folder to insert your images, you can just use some markdown code or html to insert images in the format you want.

item.title: Results Section Two
item.description: [Here you will describe the data discoversy process, the data used, and the methods employed for this single page. Since you already have a Project Overview and Data & Methods tabs, you probably want to keep this first paragraph fairly short and use the rest of the document to walk your readers through your analyses.] Main Findings [Here you will describe the results and include important visualizations from your project.

item.title: test
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:
